snippet: More people worldwide are living into old age, but the gains in the United States were much smaller, according to a new study.
abstract: Report published in journal Lancet finds more people worldwide are living into old age and dying from diseases mostly associated with rich countries, like cancer and heart disease; also shows life expectancy gains in United States are much smaller, with American women only expected to live just under two more years of life.

byline.contributor: Donald G. McNeil Jr. contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: More people worldwide are living into old age, but the gains in the United States were much smaller, according to a new study.

headline.seo: Life Expectancy Rises Around World, Study Finds
headline.main: Life Expectancy Rises Around the World, Study Finds
headline.print_headline: Life Expectancy Rises Around World, Study Finds
